docs.summary: > **Note:** The Item Modifier Groups API only works with the Wix Restaurants Menus (New) app. Make sure you downloaded this app from [Wix App Market](https://www.wix.com/app-market/wix-restaurants-menus-new).
description:
Bulk update a Modifier Group, supports partial update.
Each time a modifier group is updated, revision increments by 1. The existing revision must be included when updating modifier group. This ensures you're working with the latest item information, and it prevents unintended overwrites.
Up to 100 modifier groups can be returned per request.

bulkUpdateModifierGroups example for exporting from backend code

description:
Creates a modifier group.
To create multiple modifier groups at once, use [Bulk Create Modifiers](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/business-solutions/restaurants/menus/item-modifier-groups/bulk-create-modifier-groups).

docs.summary: > **Note:** The Item Modifier Groups API only works with the Wix Restaurants Menus (New) app. Make sure you downloaded this app from [Wix App Market](https://www.wix.com/app-market/wix-restaurants-menus-new).
description: Retrieves a list of modifier groups given the provided paging, filtering, and sorting. Up to 100 modifier groups can be returned per request.

For a detailed list of supported operations, see the [Supported Filters and Sorting](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/business-solutions/restaurants/menus/item-modifier-groups/supported-filters-and-sorting) article. To learn how to query modifier groups, see [API Query Language](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/api-query-language).

queryModifierGroups example for exporting from backend code

docs.summary: > **Note:** The Item Modifier Groups API only works with the Wix Restaurants Menus (New) app. Make sure you downloaded this app from [Wix App Market](https://www.wix.com/app-market/wix-restaurants-menus-new).
description:
Updates a modifier group.
Each time a modifier group is updated, revision increments by 1. The existing revision must be included when updating the modifier group. This ensures you're working with the latest modifier group information, and it prevents unintended overwrites.

examples.title: updateModifierGroup example for dashboard page code
updateModifierGroup example for exporting from backend code
body: const result = await elevatedUpdateModifierGroup(id, modifierGroup, options);

members.name: additionalCharge
members.doc: Additional charge to the item modifier. The value of `0` means the item modifier is free.

members.name: appDefId
members.doc: The AppDefId

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: The instance Id

members.name: code
members.doc: Error code.

members.name: data
members.doc: Data related to the error.

members.name: description
members.doc: Description of the error.

members.name: totalFailures
members.doc: Number of items that couldn't be processed.

members.name: totalSuccesses
members.doc: Number of items that were successfully processed.

members.name: undetailedFailures
members.doc: Number of failures without details because detailed failure threshold was exceeded.

members.name: returnEntity
members.doc: Whether to receive the created modifier groups in the response.

members.name: modifierGroups
members.doc: Modifier groups details.

members.name: itemMetadata
members.doc: Metadata for group modifier update.

members.name: modifierGroup
members.doc: Updated modifier group. Only returned if `returnEntity` is set to `true`.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: The MetaSiteId to clone from.

members.name: modifierGroup
members.doc: Modifier group details.

members.name: modifierGroup
members.doc: Modifier group.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Indicates if there are more results after the current page.
If `true`, another page of results can be retrieved.
If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: modifierGroupId
members.doc: Modifier group ID.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: namespaces
members.doc:
Extended field data. Each key corresponds to the namespace of the app that created the extended fields.
The value of each key is structured according to the schema defined when the extended fields were configured.

You can only access fields for which you have the appropriate permissions.

Learn more about [extended fields](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/extended-fields).

members.name: fileName
members.doc: Invalidate by filename (for media files such as PDFs)

members.doc: the msid the file is related to

members.name: modifierGroupId
members.doc: Modifier group ID.

members.name: modifierGroup
members.doc: Modifier group.

members.name: anonymousVisitorId
members.doc: ID of a site visitor that has not logged in to the site.

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of an app.

members.name: identityType
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ANONYMOUS_VISITOR'`
- `'APP'`
- `'MEMBER'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`
- `'WIX_USER'`

members.doc: Invalidate by msId. NOT recommended, as this will invalidate the entire site cache!

members.doc: tell us why you're invalidating the cache. You don't need to add your app name

members.name: siteId
members.doc: Invalidate by Site ID. NOT recommended, as this will invalidate the entire site cache!

members.doc: Item ID. Should always be available, unless it's impossible (for example, when failing to create an item).

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: modifierGroupIds
members.doc: Modifier group IDs.

members.doc: The identification type and identity data.

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: App instance ID.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Item modifier ID.

members.name: additionalChargeInfo
members.doc: Item modifier price details.

members.doc:
Whether the item modifier is pre-selected.
Default: `false`.

members.doc: Date and time the modifier group was created.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the modifier group was updated.

members.doc: Group of item modifiers.

members.doc: Modifier group name.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the modifier group is updated. To prevent conflicting changes, the current revision must be passed when updating the modifier group. Ignored when creating a modifier group.

members.doc: Modifier group details.

members.doc: Invalidate by Page ID

members.doc: Query options.

members.name: modifierGroups
members.doc: Retrieved modifier groups.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Metadata of the paginated results.

members.name: maxSelections
members.doc: Minimum number of item modifiers a site visitor must select. Must be greater than or equal to the value of `minSelections`.

members.name: minSelections
members.doc:
Minimum number of item modifiers a site visitor must select. The value must be lower or equal to the available item modifiers in the group.
Default: `0`.

members.name: required
members.doc: Whether the items from group modifier are required to select.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: the msid the URI is on

members.name: uriPath
members.doc: URI path to invalidate (e.g. page/my/path) - without leading/trailing slashes

members.doc: Date and time the modifier group was created.
